intro: Bidens tripartita f. orthodoxa, commonly known as the three-parted ironweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features slender, branching stems with rough, hairy surfaces and lance-shaped leaves that are often toothed or lobed. Its flowers are yellow with prominent white markings, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in moist, sunny habitats.
